results.content: This was a good match for me.  In the hands on exercises, after the introduction, I worked each of them myself before watching the teacher do her solution.  I have been a mainframe/midrange programmer for a long time, and I found some of her logic questionable.  It works, but it could be better.  For example, the exercise to find the largest value in an array would fail if it were passed an array consisting of all negative numbers.  Either the initial value should be a very largely negative number, or even better, I wrote it to set the initial value to the first entry in the array.  Then, in the loop, I started with the second value.  That will work whatever types of numbers the input array contains.  That is just one example.
results.content_html: This was a good match for me. In the hands on exercises, after the introduction, I worked each of them myself before watching the teacher do her solution. I have been a mainframe/midrange programmer for a long time, and I found some of her logic questionable. It works, but it could be better. For example, the exercise to find the largest value in an array would fail if it were passed an array consisting of all negative numbers. Either the initial value should be a very largely negative number, or even better, I wrote it to set the initial value to the first entry in the array. Then, in the loop, I started with the second value. That will work whatever types of numbers the input array contains. That is just one example.

results.content: This is a great course, the instructor is very clear and knowledgeable about every JS topic. Every time i posted a question on the Q/A she would respond immediately. This course really cleared my understanding of JavaScript!

results.content: I have some knowledge of JavaScript, and mostly purchased this course as a refresher and to work on some projects. It is a basic JavaScript course, as the title says, and definitely a great introduction for beginners. The projects really made this course even better because students can then apply what they've learned and build along with the instructor. Now that I'm done, I'm working on her JSON course. Also, the instructor is very active on the site and responds to questions promptly.

results.content:
Another fantastic course by Crypters! This is my second tutorial I've purchased and I'm seriously amazed by how much I'm learning. Before, I would get stuck because I didn't understand what teachers are doing, code may or may not work, never could get a response back from instructors on something, or just not what I'd expect. Absolutely, not the case here!

Specific things I enjoy about Crypters courses is that she test your overall knowledge of a topic by doing a multiple choice quiz. I enjoy seeing how well I understood the topic and how I rate among my peers. I also take full advantage of the small exercises that are provided. This is extremely valuable to me because this is where I can really get my hands dirty, trying to figure out that objective in my own environment and at my own pace. One last thing I really appreciate about her courses is the amount of time she takes to really explain what's really happening. For example, I've done enough tutorials that I understand functions, loops, array, etc., etc. But it's like I have no brain when I have to develop something on my own. Here - it's fully explain w/ why's & hows and usually after each section you get a full summary again.

Overall, these are simply some of the best courses and will continue to purchase and take these classes as long as they are pushing me to learn. Perfect for beginners and/or newbs like me getting started and still trying to understand the complexity of JS

results.content: This is a great course with a great instructor, I have learned more from her in the first few videos than I ever learned from other javascript courses with tutors who were not a patch on this woman.  She is great and she never talks down to her students, and if she is not running her own teaching company, she should be, because she is that good. I have the highest respect for her and her professional delivery, for a while I thought I would never be able to get javascript into my head and then I found this course with this great instructor. Take it from me, if you are struggling with learning javascript then this is the course for you. Great course, great instructor. Cheers, John

results.content:
handling of strings as arrays is not recommended

Accessing a String as an Array is Unsafe
You might have seen code like this, accessing a string as an array:
var str = "HELLO WORLD";

str[0];                   // returns H 
This is unsafe and unpredictable: 
It does not work in all browsers (not in IE5, IE6, IE7)
It makes strings look like arrays (but they are not)
str[0] = "H" does not give an error (but does not work) 
If you want to read a string as an array, convert it to an array first.

http://www.w3schools.com/js/js_string_methods.asp

Apart from that a good introduction.
